column4: hi everyone, whenever i install or remove something i get an error: E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (1) . how can i fix it?
have you updated first with sudo apt-get update?
yes
what package is it failing on ?
any package
i get an error even installing through software-center
from both command line and the package manager ?
yes
synaptic or software center
are you sure don't have a package process hung up in the background somewhere then?
not sure, but i have restarted several times, but the problem remains
yes, they install and run

aside form forcing the package ( which is normally not a good idea) then, update and try reinstall again, not sure where the issue could be. you could try cd /var/lib/dpkg/info  nd look for any bad packages and remove them, but that can be dangerous.
calso look at cleaning out /var/cache/apt/archives  then make a /partial dir and update again, sometimes things get hung on the cache, but that's a long shot.
put the output here in pastebin: http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/
also, do you use Tex fer writing docs with? you can remove them, and redo the updates and re-install Tex again after.
you get you probem sorted ?
well done !
same problem is back ?
wiht the issues you had in upgrading, you may consider un-installing one player, then re-installing it again to test one of them.
tried this already... no result
